pdf.name: SQL Basics (from provided excerpt)
pdf.description: Topics and Q&A extracted from the provided SQL learning text (intro, core statements, operators, constraints, and table/database operations).

question.title: SQL basics and the SELECT statement

questions.question: What does SQL stand for?
questions.answer: SQL stands for Structured Query Language.
questions.source_text:
•
SQL stands for Structured Query Language
•
SQL lets you access and manipulate databases

questions.question: What is the SELECT statement used for, and what is the result called?
questions.answer: The SELECT statement selects data from a database, and the result is stored in a result table called the result-set.
questions.source_text:
The SELECT statement is used to select data from a database. The result is stored in a result table, called the
result-set.

questions.question: In a SELECT statement, what does the asterisk (*) indicate?
questions.answer: It is a quick way of selecting all columns.
questions.source_text: Tip: The asterisk (*) is a quick way of selecting all columns!

question.title: Filtering results: DISTINCT, quoting text, and AND logic

questions.question: What does the DISTINCT keyword do in a SELECT query?
questions.source_text: The DISTINCT keyword can be used to return only distinct (different) values.

questions.question: In SQL, what kind of quotes are used around text values?
questions.answer: SQL uses single quotes around text values (many systems also accept double quotes).
questions.source_text: SQL uses single quotes around text values (most database systems will also accept double quotes).

questions.question: When does the AND operator include a record in the result?
questions.answer: A record is included only if both conditions are true.
questions.source_text: The AND operator displays a record if both the first condition and the second condition is true.

question.title: Sorting query results with ORDER BY

questions.question: By default, what order does ORDER BY sort records in?
questions.source_text: The ORDER BY keyword sort the records in ascending order by default.

questions.question: How do you sort results by LastName in descending order (as shown in the example)?
questions.answer: Use: SELECT * FROM Persons ORDER BY LastName DESC.
questions.source_text:
SELECT * FROM Persons
ORDER BY LastName DESC

questions.question: In the shown sorted result-set, which LastName appears first?

question.title: Modifying data: INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE

questions.question: What INSERT statement is used to add a new row to the Persons table in the example?
What warning is given about omitting the WHERE clause in an UPDATE statement?
questions.answer: If you omit the WHERE clause, all records will be updated.
questions.source_text: �ote: Notice the WHERE clause in the UPDATE syn...ed. If you omit the WHERE clause, all records will be updated!

questions.question: How can you delete all rows in a table without deleting the table itself?
questions.answer: Use DELETE FROM table_name or DELETE * FROM table_name.
questions.source_text:
DELETE FROM table_name                        or
DELETE * FROM table_name

question.title: Creating and changing structures: CREATE DATABASE/TABLE and ALTER TABLE

questions.question: What is the SQL syntax to create a new database?
questions.source_text:
SQL CREATE DATABASE Syntax
CREATE DATABASE database_name

questions.question: In the Persons table example, what data types are used for P_Id and the name/address fields?
questions.answer: P_Id is int. LastName, FirstName, Address, and City are varchar with a maximum length of 255 characters.
questions.source_text: The P_Id column is of type int and will hold a ...s are of type varchar with a maximum length of 255 characters.

questions.question: How do you add a DateOfBirth column to the Persons table, and what type is it?
questions.answer: ALTER TABLE Persons ADD DateOfBirth date. The column type is date.
questions.source_text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD DateOfBirth date
